Hello, there. I’m Jami Gibbs. I’m a frontend developer and designer from Chicago. Some would call me a unicorn. I founded Rescue Themes which specializes in nonprofit and niche WordPress themes and I’ve also created a number of open source projects using JavaScript, Angular, & Jekyll.

In my spare time I like to kick up road dust and pour down a few craft brews.

I’m currently exploring JavaScript libraries and frameworks like React and Node and actively seeking opportunities that put my design and development skills to use. Get in touch.

Latest Work

Scribe

A WordPress theme that excels as a writing tool. Built with [_s](http://underscores.me/), [Foundation](http://foundation.zurb.com/), and Sass.

Phantom

A minimalist, responsive portfolio theme for Jekyll with Bootstrap.

Grocery Store Monopoly Exchange

A SPA that lists a directory of user inputed tickets from the grocery store Monopoly game to facilitate exchanges with friends & family built with JavaScript and Angular.

Calculator

A functional calculator that can perform basic operations built with JavaScript, jQuery, & Sass

Simon Game

The classic memory game built with JavaScript, jQuery, & Sass.

Contact Me

Send me an email or ping me on Twitter. I’m also on Github, Dribbble, and Linkedin if you’re into that sort of thing.
